title: Scaling a mesh in use the <scale> parameter in SDF causes Simbody to crash.

content.raw:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a planar mesh
1. Scale the Z using the SDF <scale> parameter under the <mesh> tag axis by a large factor, in my case around 10^6
1. Load the SDF using Simbody
1. Watch Gazebo throw this error: 

~~~
what(): SimTK Exception thrown at MassProperties.h:538:
Error detected by Simbody method Inertia::operator-=(): Diagonals of an Inertia matrix must be nonnegative; got 6.73672e-08,-3.50725e-08,-3.94697e-08.
(Required condition 'd >= -SignificantReal' was not met.)
~~~

More details:

 - The mass was specified to a value around 10^-6.
 - The pose of the inertial frame was specified, but the inertia tensors were not specified for debugging purposes.
 - Deleting the above two values allowed the SDF to load correctly.
content.html:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. Create a planar mesh
  2. Scale the Z using the SDF <scale> parameter under the <mesh> tag axis by a large factor, in my case around 10^6
  3. Load the SDF using Simbody
  4. Watch Gazebo throw this error: 
what(): SimTK Exception thrown at MassProperties.h:538:
Error detected by Simbody method Inertia::operator-=(): Diagonals of an Inertia matrix must be nonnegative; got 6.73672e-08,-3.50725e-08,-3.94697e-08.
(Required condition 'd >= -SignificantReal' was not met.)

More details:

  • The mass was specified to a value around 10^-6.
  • The pose of the inertial frame was specified, but the inertia tensors were not specified for debugging purposes.
  • Deleting the above two values allowed the SDF to load correctly.
